Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Evidence Statements: The student can illustrate a plant that has received enough water and is growing healthily.
The student can draw a plant that has not received water and shows signs of not growing well.
The student can represent how plants need water to live and grow, showing the difference between a healthy plant and one without water.
The student can depict the importance of light for plant growth by showing an area with light and another without light and how plants look in each environment.
